instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..
definitions.PP3V3_G3S: What is PP3V3_G3S? PP3V3_G3S is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in a G3S standby state. .

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0A after orange juice spill
threads.message:
Data Recovery case - Lot of orange spill all over the place <CHIP>U6960</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>, <CHIP>U9060</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7660</TRANSISTOR>/7680

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12V
<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> - 0.13V

<SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS</SIGNAL>=5.2

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>=0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>=0.13V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL>=0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3S</SIGNAL>=0
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S</SIGNAL>=0
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3</SIGNAL>=0

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0A after orange juice spill
threads.message:
Please post EXACT <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage!

Diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>?
If good, post <CHIP>U6960</CHIP> voltages.

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0A after orange juice spill
threads.message: Thanks for pointing me in the right direction. Managed to find the cold joint on the <SIGNAL>P3V3RTC_AVIN</SIGNAL>
